messages.message:
hello team, @Ben & I had a 2 days workshop with 20+ MunichRE Tech & Business people onsite.
During this workshop, a lot of Product feedback came from the people.
Please find below a list of the whole Feedback.
Would anyone have time to go through the list during a call?

1. Prompt for all fields
2. Reverse engineering for classes
3. Move Fielder order via drag and drop
4. Create new Field by clone it
5. Custom function for classification
6. A Graph requested: How much each run of documents costs per use case for example. This indicates an estimation of how much a use case costs per run 
7. API to automatically import fields and classes and prompts
8. Re-use single elements like a field from other use cases. Not copy paste manually
cc: @Filippo

I would also love to hear any feedback as it relates to how we can better enable them too. If there are any questions that they had, resources they requested, etc. can you please either pass it my way or schedule time with me to cover? Thanks!

1. not sure what this means
2. not sure what this means
3. this feature request is already tracked - https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-2249
4. this feature request is already tracked - https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3212
5. currently in development - https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3749
6. cc @Josh Rad on billing reporting
7. no external-facing API is currently available
8. i think this is similar to 4 and is covered in that feature request ticket?
cc @jack.robbins as well
@Raul Mächler for 6, I'm assuming you're asking for pricing estimation on their most common use cases. Are you able you share more info on the relevant use cases discussed here?

does 1) refer to the piece of the DocAI demo Anant gave a few weeks back for creating fields automatically from the uploaded project files? If so we're hoping to productize that shortly (likely within August).
Hi @Josh Rad the client would like to be able to see within AIHub more information on how much an app or run does or will cost. So they would like to have better visibility of ongoing costs

in addition to Filippo’s message: the client said, they would like to see each use case they have in production, how much in average it costs per run. For example if they run it once per day, for a year, how much did they spend on each run in average.

@jack.robbins the client meant to have the same prompt for different fields across doc types
For example: client name or address on docs like payslip, bankstatement, id card etc. so they dont have to write the same prompt multiple times.
